item.description:
We hope you've set aside Sunday, July 15, 1 PM for the chance to be
together and explore the unique and wonderful setting of the Peace Abbey,
visit the animals, enjoy a great vegan potluck meal, and hear Will
Tuttle, PhD speak on his book _The Word Peace Diet_. His presentation
will include an interlude of his original piano music, and his book and
CDs will be for sale and signing afterwards -- a good chance to buy gifts
for those you care about.

Rain or shine, it will be a beautiful day. Please bring friends, family,
and non-vegetarians -- we especially want non-vegetarians to experience a
fabulous vegan meal and hear this speaker! But never hesitate to come
alone; lot's do, and we're a friendly group.

Below are the details you'll need:

1) RSVP
2) Volunteering
3) Donation for the Peace Abbey
4) Car pooling
5) Directions to Peace Abbey
6) Free parking
7) Logistics - Seating, rest rooms, speaker site
8) Overnight accommodations on site

1) RSVP

It helps us to plan, so please hit "Reply" and give the names of people
attending.

4) CAR POOLING - DRIVERS needed - all replies by Thursday. 7/12 5 PM

Car pooling is a good way to meet some people before arriving at the
event, and to save fuel resources. Riders, please offer to chip in for
gas. Here's how it works:

If you CAN GIVE or need a ride, please reply by Thurs., 7/12 at 5 PM,
using the below format only, so I can quickly cut and paste info into a
group e-mail. On Thurs. PM, I'll compile the responses and send them to
the group. Then respondents can get in touch with each other to work out
their own arrangements.

**Please reply only in this format**:
Your Name
Your E-mail Address
Your Phone Number
Can you give a ride? / Do you need a ride?
Your Town (or where you can meet)

5) DIRECTIONS

The Peace Abbey
2 North Main Street
Where Route 27 and Route 16 overlap
Sherborn, MA (next to Natick, 35-40 min. west of Boston)

>>From Boston:
Take Route 9 West and exit at Route 16 in Wellesley. The Rt. 16 sign is
easy to miss, but it follows a yellow blinking light and a sign for Mass
Bay Community College. Turn left at end of ramp onto Rt. 16 West.
Follow directions below from Rt. 16 exit off Mass Pike.
~ OR ~
Take the Mass Pike West to Exit 16 (Wellesley) Take Route 16 West,
winding scenically through Wellesley, Natick, and into Sherborn. Watch
carefully the Rt. 16 signs, because Rt. 16 takes some sharp left turns.

*You are almost at the Peace Abbey* when you see the Sherborn Inn on your
right, then the Sherborn Fire House (white) on your left. When you ride
over a small railroad track, and go up a small hill, the Peace Abbey is
just ahead on your left, just after an area of trees. There are signs
and a large statue of Gandhi out front.

>>From the West:
Take Route 9 East, then take Route 27 South through Natick and into
Sherborn. Rt. 27 will overlap with Rt. 16 in Sherborn, so see directions
above for landmarks on Rt. 16/27.

6) FREE PARKING

a) The small paved lot at the Abbey will be for special needs / handicap
parking, speakers, and press ONLY.

b) Street parking: Approaching from the north (that is, if you are on
Rt. 16W or Rt. 27S, which overlap), pass the Peace Abbey driveway on your
left. Go just beyond the Gandhi statue and take the next left. Park
along this road "Village Way" ON ONE SIDE OF THE ROAD ONLY. Two sided
parking is *not allowed*. This road leads to a housing complex. Park
ONLY along the entrance road. Do *NOT* park in the visitor or resident
spaces for the housing park!
NOTE: They will tow cars parked where I've said not to park.

c) Church lot: We can park in the Unitarian Universalist Church lot
just a 2-3 minute walk from the Peace Abbey. This is where the speaker
presentation will be. If you like, you can drop off your potluck dish at
the Peace Abbey gate, then go park. We'll put your dish on the stone
fence till you return. Approaching from the north, pass the Peace Abbey
on your left, and you will face a fork in the road. Go to *right* of
fork (Rt. 16). Continue a very short bit further and you'll see the U.U.
Church (white wooden historic church) on your left. Park in the lots on
both sides of the church.


7) LOGISTICS - to make your visit easy

Walk up the wooden ramp into the main building to the kitchen. There
will be seating for eating on the main level, plus go down the stairs
(via the kitchen) to the large basement room, where there will be lots of
tables and chairs.

The rest rooms are on this lower/basement level. When we move to the
church for the speaker program, there are rest rooms there, too, just
behind the speaker room.

The "beverage station" will be set up just outside the kitchen, on the
lawn. It's smart to bring your own water bottle, too.

At 2:50 please start your stroll to the white church for our speaker program at 3 PM!
item.name: BVS Peace Abbey event...vegan potluck and a speaker!
